intro: Alantsilodendron humbertii, commonly known as the Humbert's alant, is a rare and unique plant native to the high-altitude regions of Madagascar. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its distinctive, compound leaves and umbellate inflorescence. The plant is notable for its medicinal properties, with traditional uses in treating respiratory and digestive ailments. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered endangered and requires conservation efforts to ensure its survival.
